results.name: The odd part of {Euler totient function phi applied to the prime shifted n}: a(n) = A000265(A000010(A003961(n))).
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..8191
Antti Karttunen, Data supplement: n, a(n) computed for n = 1..65537
Index entries for sequences computed from indices in prime factorization
formula: Multiplicative with a(p^e) = A000265(q-1) * q^(e-1), where q = A151800(p), the next prime larger than p.
For all squarefree numbers k, a(k) = A339903(k).
program: A003961(n) = { my(f = factor(n)); for(i=1, #f~, f[i, 1] = nextprime(f[i, 1]+1)); factorback(f); };
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Dec 29 2020
